document.docAuthor: Gao, Yan, Xiong, Yan & Potapov, Mikhail
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of Chinese Isotomidae (Collembola) and a description of a new Subisotoma

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of Chinese Isotomidae (Collembola) and a description of a new Subisotoma

subSubSection.paragraph:
I. fiscus Christiansen & Bellinger
(Shanghai, Zhejiang). Described from U.S.A.
I. xishaensis
Chen, 1986
(Guangdong).

C. thermophilus (Axelson)
(Guangdong, Shanghai, Taiwan ). Cosmopolitan species.

* M. achromata
Bellinger (
Chen & Shin 1990 : Jilin
).

F. parvulus Stach
sensu lato
(often as
F.americanus Denis
, or F.e x i g u u s Folsom, Hubei, Sichuan, Guizhou, Hunan, Shanghai, Zhejiang, Jilin). Cosmopolitan species.

D. huadongensis (
Chen, 1985
)
(Shanghai). It was described in genus
Proisotoma
. Generic position of the species is unclear since
Dimorphotoma
is a junior synonym of
Scutisotoma
.

* F. agrelli
Gisin (Hubei). Northern areas of Europe. It is obviously erroneous record.

* F. bisetosa
Gisin (
Chen & Shin 1990 : Jilin
). Northern areas of Holarctic. It is probably an erroneous record.
F. c a n d i d a Willem (Hunan, Hubei, Guangdong, Zhejiang). Widely distributed cosmopolitan species.

F. decemoculata Stach
(Beijing). Europe. Obviously erroneous record.

F. diplophthalma (Axelson)
(Hubei, Jiangsu, Shanghai, Shanxi, Zhejiang,
Chen & Shin , 1990
: Jilin). All Chinese records before the recent redescription (
Potapov & Dunger 2000
) should be verified as the distribution range of this species seems to be restricted to northern areas of Palaearctic.

* F. fimetaria
Linnaeus (
Chen & Sin 1990 : Jilin
)

* F. hubeiensis
Ding, Huang & Chen, 2006
(
Ding et al. 2006 a
: Hubei).

* F. imadatei
Tamura & Zhao, 2000 (
Tamura & Zhao 2000 b: Yunnan
).

F. inoculata (Stach)
(Hunan, Yunnan, Zhejiang). It was recorded under the name
F.ezoensis Yosii. Widely
distributed in Palearctic.

* F. nanjingensis
Ding, Ji & Chen, 2006
(
Ding et al. 2006 b
: Jiangsu).

F. octoculata Handschin
(Hubei, Hunan, Guangdong, Guizhou, Hunan, Yunnan, Zhejiang;
Chen & Shin 1990
: Jilin). Widely distributed in E Asia.

F. quadrioculata (Tullberg)
(Hebei, Yunnan). Widely distributed in Holarctic.

F. re g u l a r i s Hammer (Anhui, Hebei). According to
Potapov & Babenko ( 2000 )
it is distributed only in the High Arctic of North America and East Palaearctic. The records of this arctic species in China and adjacent countries call for the verification.
F. s t e l l a Christiansen et Tucker (Hebei). Described from U.S.A. , the distribution is unclear.

P. f r a t e r n a
Rusek, 1967
(Guangdong, Shanghai). P. m i n u t a (Tullberg) (Hebei, Jilin; cosmopolitan species).

A. stebayevae (Grinbergs)
. Possibly a senior synonym of
Proisotoma xinjiangica
Hao et Huang, 1995
described from Xinjiang. Widely distributed in continental areas of Asia.

* S. potapovi
Xie & Chen, 2008
(
Xie & Chen 2008 : Jiangsu
). The generic position is unclear.

Isotomiella minor (Schäffer)
(Guangdong, Guizhou, Hubei, Hunan;
Chen & Shin 1990
: Jilin). Cosmopolitan.

D. caeruleatra (Guthrie)
(Sichuan). Described from U.S.A.
D. imparidentata (
Stach, 1964
)
(Zhejiang).

D. tianshanica
Hao & Huang, 1995
(Xinjiang).
D. tigrina Nicolet
(Shanghai). Cosmopolitan species.

I. quadridentata
Huang & Liang, 1994
(Xizang). The species was described in the genus Acanthisotoma Bonet.

I. viridis Bourlet
(Hubei). Cosmopolitan. Records of the species call for the verification as
I. viridis
received a new, more strict, understanding (
Fjellberg 2003
).

I. palustris (Müller)
(Beijing, Jiangsu, Zhejiang). A cosmopolitan species but it is probably more geographically restricted since a new understanding proposed by
Carapelli et al. ( 2000 )
.

I. palustroides Folsom
(Hebei). Described from U.S.A.

M. grandiceps (Reuter)
(Jilin). Northern areas of Holarctic.

P. monticola (
Hao & Huang, 1995
)
(Xinjiang). Possibly a junior synonym of
P. notabilis
.

P. hyonosenensis (Yosii)
. Possibly a senior synonym of
P. pseudosetispinosa (
Chen, 1985
)
(Shanghai) and
P. setispinosa Lee
(recorded by
Chen & Shin 1990
as
Desoria setispinosa
in Jilin).

P. y i n a e (
Hao & Huang, 1995
) (Xinjiang). Possibly a junior synonym of
P. removeophthalma Martynova
(Far East of Russia ).

V. c i n e re u s (Nicolet) (Fujian; Holarctic).
V. arborata
Huang, Yin & Liang, 1993
(Hebei).

Pseudisotoma sensibilis (Tullberg)
(Jiangxi). Widely distributed in Holarctic.

* T. sinensis
Yue & Yin, 1999
(Shanghai). The description of the species was probably based on individual affected by ecomorphosis. Generic position of the species and status of the genus are unclear.
P. s i m p l e x Denis, 1929 (Jiangsu, Shanghai, Yunnan; Holarctic).
